text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention jurisdictional asymmetry (traditional BITs grant rights to investors but not obligations to states). While the response discusses the 'equality of arms' principle (point I.3 and VI.Policy Arguments), which is related to the imbalance of rights/obligations, it does not explicitly frame the issue in terms of 'jurisdictional asymmetry' where traditional BITs are inherently one-sided, which is the core concept tested by this criterion.", "criterion_id": "7a4768bf-62c5-4ccc-b79c-ca96f0d8f557"}
